etymology.description: 精制 + 品 = finely processed/refined + product(s).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to goods that have undergone fine processing to improve purity, quality, or performance. Common in contexts such as food, chemicals, and pharmaceuticals.
etymology.simplification: 製 was simplified to 制 by dropping the 衣 component and reusing the existing character 制 to reduce strokes; 品 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这家工厂专门生产粮油精制品(這家工廠專門生產糧油精製品)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngchǎng zhuānmén shēngchǎn liángyóu jīngzhìpǐn.
examples.english: This factory specializes in producing refined grain and oil products.

examples.chinese: 进口精制品需要严格检验(進口精製品需要嚴格檢驗)。
examples.english: Imported refined products require strict inspection.

examples.chinese: 超市里有许多海盐精制品(超市裡有許多海鹽精製品)。
examples.pinyin: Chāoshì lǐ yǒu xǔduō hǎiyán jīngzhìpǐn.
examples.english: There are many refined sea-salt products in the supermarket.
